body.text: To use the team forming dashboard,
dotpoints: Create a new offering for the unit you are currently running
Enter the unit and Upload your CSV list of students with their student details
Upload Student personality data in accordance with the strategy you would like to form teams against
Select your group formation strategy adn form groups
Optionally export information as a CSV file to upload to other learning management systems

questions.title: What type of CSV data are accepted?

body.text: Student data can be imported from a .csv file formatted as shown in the table below. The restrictions on data types are the following:
dotpoints: labCode must be prefixed by the number and '_' minimally
gender must be a single char

body.text: Belbin Team roles is a theory developed by Dr. Meredith Belbin, where these roles describe the behavioural patterns that people exhibit within teams, highlighting their strengths and weaknesses. Belbin type must be one of: People, Thinking or Action.
Hours commitment is the estimated number of hours that a student expects to commit in a week.

The Student are formed into groups using one of multiple available group formation strategies such as 'Belbin Roles' or 'Estimated Effort'. The uploaded CSV data of students and their Belbin roles or Effort data is fed to the algorithm to produce groups with maximum efficiency. In future developments, BaLance will allow users to upload custom python scripts which will run on user data and populate teams based on the provided algorithms.

questions.title: Can I reconfigure the teams afterwards

body.text: As of current iteration, BaLance does not allow manual reconfiguration of student teams other than removal of students.
